page.title: 08COLESBOURNE ST.JAMES CHURCH.
page.content: Colesbourne Church was built about 700 years ago and dedicated to{St James.} It is a{cruciform}Church.Services are held every Sunday.The Rector is Canon Pulford,who serves three parishes these are Colesbourne,Cowley and Coberley.They belong to the Deanary of Cirecester (17 are on the church electoral roll).The Sunday School is held every month at Coberley Colesbourne Church has five bells but they are not rung.In the Church there is an old{stone Wine Glass Pulpit. There are some special pews in the North transept which are used by important villagers such as the Elwes family.There are plaques on the wall; memorials to the Elwes family.Two pillars by the Chancel are all that remains of the Norman church. There is an old tile on the wall outside which shows the crucifixion.
